availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Quilbert Chenoweth (Mercer County, Kentucky, notary public and colonel)

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, notary public and soldier. Jefferson County, Kentucky, native. Son of Thomas Chenoweth and Nancy Passmore Chenoweth. Married to Scota M. Inskeep Chenoweth. Student in Mercer County, Kentucky, in 1850. Graduate of Indiana Asbury University (now DePauw University) in Greencastle, Indiana, in 1860. Resident of Mercer County in 1860. Appointed notary public for Mercer County on March 13, 1861. Served in Bennett's Tennessee Cavalry Battalion (C.S.A.) as drillmaster from 1861 to 1862. Wounded in action at the Battle of Shiloh. Mustered in as major in the 1st Kentucky Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) on September 2, 1862. Wounded in action at the Battle of Chickamauga. Appointed colonel and raised the 16th (Chenoweth's) Kentucky Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) on September 6, 1864. Surrendered in Paris, Tennessee, on May 4, 1865. Signed a loyalty oath to the U.S. Government on May 12, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, p. 367A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, p. 708.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, p. 595A.
Bruce S. Allardice and Lawrence Lee Hewitt, Kentuckians in Gray: Confederate Generals and Field Officers of the Bluegrass State, (Lexington, KY: The University Press of Kentucky, 1866), 2014.
School Catalogues (1765-1935), Catalogue of Officers and Students of Indiana Asbury University, Greencastle, Indiana.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0066.
Find A Grave, "James Quilbert Chenoweth (1841-1909)," Memorial #95625835, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/95625835 (accessed April 13, 2021).
